snippet: The U.S.-China Business Council issued a report taking aim at China’s antimonopoly law, highlighting ways it says enforcement could be improved.
abstract: United States-China Business Council, group that lobbies on behalf of about 220 large American companies with operations in China, issues report taking direct aim at China's aggressive application of antimonopoly law and highlighting ways enforcement can be improved; move is apparent push back on China's antitrust clampdown on companies like Microsoft, Qualcomm and others.
lead_paragraph: The U.S.-China Business Council issued a report taking aim at China’s antimonopoly law, highlighting ways it says enforcement could be improved.

headline.main: Western Companies Appear to Push Back Against Chinese Crackdown
headline.print_headline: Western Companies Appear to Push Back Against Chinese Crackdown
